skos:Collection.skos:definition: A controlled vocabulary to be used to describe constraints on the usage of metadata and/or data. Ideally as little constraints as possible is defined. The definitions below relate to Creative Commons, Open Data Commons and NLOD (Norway).

skos:Concept.skos:definition: All rights for these data are waived. This should be relevant when data are released using CC0, Open Data Commons PDDL or similar.
These data may be freely copied, shared, used, modified and transformed as long as you attribute the owner/creator of the original dataset.

skos:member.skos:Concept:
Share-alike
This is a bit stronger than attribution as it requires any work based upon these data to be shared using the same conditions as the original data. It implies attribution and limits the freedom for new data generated.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: Data may be used for noncommercial purposes only. This implies share-alike (and attribution).
